text:
in this case:
`df1['Subjectivity'] = df1['Review Text'].apply(sentiment).apply(lambda x: np.Nan if x!=x else x[1])`
could do the trick

text: if one line is Nan, that means for that specific `x` the condition `x!=x` is true, so your lambda function will return `np.nan` , else the second part of your tuple

x
the condition
x!=x
is true, so your lambda function will return
np.nan
, else the second part of your tuple
